about.text-personal: On a short note about me, I consider myself a very dedicated, passionate and fun guy. I love to spend time with my family and friends, and I think there is no party that beats a good Sunday barbecue.
about.text-professional: Professionally, I'm now with over 5 year of development experience and my love for it continues to grow as I practice. Over this time I've had contact with many technologies, starting with C++ when working with safes and ATMs, to prototyping and developing a digital wallet for Android with Java, to making beautiful web applications in ReactJS.
about.text-fav-tech: For most of my carrier I've also performed the role of UX Analyst, leading the creation process of many features and applications with deliverables such as mocked screens and/or functional high fidelity prototypes in Figma.

experiences.responsabilities: As the only frontend developer in the company, my main responsability it to care of any improvements or addition of new features to Dootax's web application (built in AngularJS), which is the one clients are in touch everyday; Part of my job is also interacting with differents teams such as Marketing and UX, to gather relevant information and transform them into improvements to the app. My biggest challenge in the company is to reprogram the outdated web application made with AngularJs, but this time in ReactJs, using all its best tools.

As a member of Product's team, I act both as a UX/UI analist and frontend developer (always giving a hand when needed in the backend), and my main responsabilities are participate in early discussions/braisntorms about a new project/feature, prototype screens with mockups (low and high fidelity) and implement the frontend.
The technology that I've been in most contact with during this position is ReactJS + Typecript, which I fell in love with and already built some cool applications using all Reacts' best tools: Redux, Router, Hooks, Styled Components, Maps (Google Maps and Open Street Maps), ContextAPI, High Order Components and etc...

As an UX Analist I could dig a little deeper in a world which is totally connected with frontend development. I got to learn from an experienced team and participate in big projects, one of which got me a trip to South Korea to make a presentation at an UX Workshop at the Samsung's Head Quarters(Yey!!). With my background in Computer Science I could play an important part when presenting and discussing the team's work (majority of times screen flows) from a more techincal point of view with the developers' team also involved in the projects.

As part of the Digital team (which was mainly involved in the development of a digital wallet), my responsabilities went from planning features and it's screens for the wallet to implementing the screens and APIs.
The tech stack which I was involved in this position was: a lot of native Android with Java and XML (working with permissions, camera, gps, bluetooth, material design/third-party libraries/custom components for the layouts) and Figma for prototyping.

As an Intern and member of Terminals' team, my job was to help in the development/improvement of features and drivers for ATM's and safe's applications. I've also worked with Android apps, communicating with PINPads via bluetooth.

As a member of the Hollywood Studio's Operations and Attractions team, I was responsable for assisting the operations at some of the park's theaters and events in general (like the parades!). Some of my responsabilities involved activities from walking around the park greeting and helping guests, to help organizing the theaters prior to the shows (checking benches, emergency exits, bathrooms, etc...), make sure the guests were ok during the shows and help to clean afterwards.
